00030 #define FILTER_ORDER 2
00031 #define N_FILTERS    50
00032 
00033 static double filters_a[N_FILTERS+1][FILTER_ORDER+1];
00034 static double filters_b[N_FILTERS+1][FILTER_ORDER+1];

00037 /*!*****************************************************************************
00038  *******************************************************************************
00039 \note  filtfilt
00040 \date  10/20/91 
00041    
00042 \remarks 
00043 
00044         filters a vector with a second order butterworth filter
00045         with zero phase lag
00046 
00047  *******************************************************************************
00048  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00049 
00050  \param[in]     vec        : vector of data
00051  \param[in]     nr         : number of element in vector
00052  \param[in]     cutoff     : cutoff in percent (integer) of Nyquist frequency
00053  \param[out]    vec_out    : filtered output vector
00054       
00055 
00056  ******************************************************************************/
00057 int
00058 filtfilt( double *vec, int nr, int cutoff, double *vec_out)
00059 {
00060 
00061   static int firsttime = TRUE;
00062   FILE *filterfile;
00063   int count_v=0, count_r=0;
00064   int i,j,n;
00065   double *temp;
00066   double aux;
<<<<<<< HEAD
00067   char   fname[strlen(getenv("LAB_ROOT"))+100];
00068   int rc;
00069 
00070   if (cutoff == 0) { /* this takes the mean of all values */
00071     aux = 0;
00072     for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
00073       aux += vec[i];
00074     }
00075     aux /= (double)nr;
00076     for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
00077       vec_out[i] = aux;
00078     }
00079     return TRUE;
00080   }
00081   
00082   if (cutoff == 100) { /* just copy */
00083     for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
00084       vec_out[i] = vec[i];
00085     }
00086     return TRUE;
00087   }
00088   
00089   if (cutoff > N_FILTERS || cutoff < 1) {
00090     printf("filter with cutoff %d not implemented! Exit ....\n",cutoff);
00091     exit(-999);
00092   }
00093 
00094   temp = my_vector(1,nr);
00095 
00096   for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
00097     temp[i] = vec[i];
00098   }
00099 
00100 
00101   if (firsttime) {
00102 
00103     firsttime = FALSE;
00104     
00105     /* read in the filter file */
00106     
00107     sprintf(fname,"%s/utilities/filters/butterworth_table_order_2",
00108             getenv("LAB_ROOT"));  
00109     filterfile = fopen(fname,"r");
00110     
00111     if (filterfile == NULL) {
00112       
00113       printf("Cannot find filter file >%s<\n",fname);
00114       printf("Hit return to exit ...\n");
00115       getchar();
00116       
00117       exit (-999);
00118       
00119     }
00120     
00121     for (i=1; i<=N_FILTERS; ++i) {
00122       
00123       ++count_r;
00124       
00125       for (j=0; j<= FILTER_ORDER; ++j) {
00126         
00127         ++count_v;
00128         
00129         rc = fscanf(filterfile,"%lf",&(filters_a[i][j]));
00130         
00131       }
00132       
00133       for (j=0; j<= FILTER_ORDER; ++j) {
00134         
00135         ++count_v;
00136         
00137         rc = fscanf(filterfile,"%lf",&(filters_b[i][j]));
00138         
00139       }
00140       
00141     }
00142     
00143     fclose (filterfile);
00144     
00145     printf("\nRead file of butterworth filter coefficients: #rows=%d  #val=%d\n",
00146            count_r,count_v);
00147 
00148 
00149   }
00150 
00151   temp[1] = vec[1];
00152   temp[2] = vec[2];
00153 
00154   for (i=3; i<=nr; ++i) {
00155     
00156     temp[i] = 
00157       filters_b[cutoff][0] * vec[i] + 
00158         filters_b[cutoff][1] * vec[i-1] + 
00159           filters_b[cutoff][2] * vec[i-2] -
00160             (filters_a[cutoff][1] * temp[i-1] +
00161              filters_a[cutoff][2] * temp[i-2]);
00162     
00163   }
00164   
00165  
00166   for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
00167     vec_out[i] = temp[i];
00168   }
00169 
00170   for (i=nr-2; i>=1; --i) {
00171     
00172     vec_out[i] = 
00173       filters_b[cutoff][0] * temp[i] + 
00174         filters_b[cutoff][1] * temp[i+1] + 
00175           filters_b[cutoff][2] * temp[i+2] -
00176             (filters_a[cutoff][1] * vec_out[i+1] +
00177              filters_a[cutoff][2] * vec_out[i+2]);
00178     
00179   }
00180   
00181   my_free_vector(temp,1,nr);
00182 
00183   return TRUE;
00184 
00185 
00186 }

00188 /*!*****************************************************************************
00189  *******************************************************************************
00190 \note  findMax
00191 \date  10/20/91 
00192    
00193 \remarks 
00194 
00195         find the maximal value in an array
00196 
00197  *******************************************************************************
00198  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00199 
00200  \param[in]     vec        : vector of data
00201  \param[in]     nr         : number of element in vector
00202  \param[out]    val        : the max value
00203 
00204       the function returns the index into the max element
00205 
00206  ******************************************************************************/
00207 int
00208 findMax( double *vec, int nr, double *val)
00209 
00210 {
00211 
00212   int i,j=0;
00213   
00214   *val = -1.e+30;
00215 
00216   for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
00217     if (vec[i] > *val) {
00218       *val = vec[i];
00219       j = i;
00220     }
00221   }
00222 
00223   return j;
00224 
00225 }

00266 /*!*****************************************************************************
00267  *******************************************************************************
00268 \note  diff
00269 \date  10/20/91 
00270    
00271 \remarks 
00272 
00273         differentiates a vector by a simple convulation
00274 
00275  *******************************************************************************
00276  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00277 
00278  \param[in]     vec        : vector of data
00279  \param[in]     nr         : number of element in vector
00280  \param[in]     dt         : delta time between data points
00281  \param[out]    vec_out    : differntiatedoutput vector
00282       
00283 
00284  ******************************************************************************/
00285 int
00286 diff( double *vec, int nr, double dt, double *vec_out)
00287 
00288 {
00289 
00290   int i,j,n;
00291   double *temp;
00292   double aux;
00293   
00294   temp = my_vector(1,nr);
00295 
00296   for (i=2; i<=nr-1; ++i) {
00297     temp[i] = (vec[i+1]-vec[i-1])/2.0/dt;
00298   }
00299   temp[1]  = temp[2];
00300   temp[nr] = temp[nr-1];
00301   
00302   for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
00303     vec_out[i] = temp[i];
00304   }
00305 
00306   my_free_vector(temp,1,nr);
00307 
00308   return TRUE;
00309 
00310 }

00312 /*!*****************************************************************************
00313  *******************************************************************************
00314 \note  diff2
00315 \date  February, 1996
00316    
00317 \remarks 
00318 
00319         differentiates a vector twice by a simple convulation
00320         NOTE: this has more bandwidth than applying diff twice
00321 
00322  *******************************************************************************
00323  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00324 
00325  \param[in]     vec        : vector of data
00326  \param[in]     nr         : number of element in vector
00327  \param[in]     dt         : delta time between data points
00328  \param[out]    vec_out    : differntiatedoutput vector
00329       
00330 
00331  ******************************************************************************/
00332 int
00333 diff2( double *vec, int nr, double dt, double *vec_out)
00334 
00335 {
00336 
00337   int i,j,n;
00338   double *temp;
00339   double aux;
00340   
00341   temp = my_vector(1,nr);
00342 
00343   for (i=2; i<=nr-1; ++i) {
00344     temp[i] = (vec[i+1]-2.*vec[i]+vec[i-1])/sqr(dt);
00345   }
00346   temp[1]  = temp[2];
00347   temp[nr] = temp[nr-1];
00348   
00349   for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
00350     vec_out[i] = temp[i];
00351   }
00352 
00353   my_free_vector(temp,1,nr);
00354 
00355   return TRUE;
00356 
00357 }

00359 /*!*****************************************************************************
00360  *******************************************************************************
00361 \note  meanvar
00362 \date  10/20/91 
00363    
00364 \remarks 
00365 
00366         calculates mean and variance of a vector
00367 
00368  *******************************************************************************
00369  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00370 
00371  \param[in]     vec        : vector of data
00372  \param[in]     nr         : number of element in vector
00373  \param[in]     thres      : threshold for outliers
00374  \param[out]    mean       : the mean value
00375  \param[out]    var        : the variance
00376  \param[out]    n_outliers : number of potential outliers
00377 
00378  ******************************************************************************/
00379 int
00380 meanvar( double *vec, int nr, double thres, double *mean, double *var, 
00381          int *n_outliers)
00382 
00383 {
00384 
00385   int i,j,n;
00386   double aux;
00387   int count;
00388 
00389   /* calculate the mean */
00390   
00391   aux = 0;
00392   for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
00393     aux += vec[i];
00394   }
00395   *mean = aux/(double)nr;
00396 
00397   /* calculate the variance */
00398 
00399   aux = 0;
00400   for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
00401     aux += sqr(vec[i]- *mean);
00402   }
00403   *var = aux/(double)(nr-1);
00404 
00405   /* count potential outliers */
00406 
00407   aux = sqrt(*var * (1.-1./(double)nr));
00408   count = 0;
00409   for (i=1; i<=nr; ++i) {
00410     if (fabs(vec[i]- *mean)/aux > thres) ++count;
00411   }
00412 
00413   *n_outliers = count;
00414 
00415   return TRUE;
00416 
00417 }

00419 /*!*****************************************************************************
00420  *******************************************************************************
00421 \note  linear_regression
00422 \date  December 1995
00423    
00424 \remarks 
00425 
00426         performs a linear regression analysis on the given data and
00427         returns the normal regression statistics, outlier statistics,
00428         and SVD information.
00429 
00430         NOTE: the data matrices are in column form, i.e, one data
00431         point per column. This allows the calling program to shift
00432         data rows in time for ARMA like analyses (as the allocation 
00433         structure of my matrices are row based)
00434 
00435         NOTE: the "1" input dimensions must be added by the calling
00436         program.
00437 
00438  *******************************************************************************
00439  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00440 
00441  \param[in]     X          : input data matrix
00442  \param[in]     Y          : output data matrix
00443  \param[in]     n_pts      : number of data points, i.e, number of columns
00444  \param[in]     n_in       : number of input dimensions
00445  \param[in]     n_out      : number of output dimensions
00446  \param[in]     outlier_threshold: statistical threshold according to normal
00447                             assumption (e.g., 1.96, 2.57, etc.)
00448       
00449 
00450  ******************************************************************************/
00451 Regression_Statistics *
00452 linearRegression(double **XX, double **YY, int n_pts, int n_in, int n_out,
00453                   double outlier_threshold)
00454 
00455 {
00456 
00457   int      i,j,k,n,m;
00458   double **XTX;
00459   double **XTY;
00460   double **res;
00461   double **Yp;
00462   double **P;
00463   double **beta;
00464   double  *sum_outputs;
00465   double  *sum_residuals;
00466   double  *sum_regression;
00467   double  *mean_outputs;
00468   double  *mean_residuals;
00469   double  *mean_regression;
00470   double  *var_outputs;
00471   double  *var_residuals;
00472   double  *var_regression;
00473   double  *r_squared;
00474   double  *r_squared_adj;
00475   double   r_squared_total;
00476   double   r_squared_adj_total;
00477   double   f_reg_total;
00478   double   p_reg_total;
00479   double  *f_reg;
00480   double  *p_reg;
00481   double **var_coeff;
00482   double **std_coeff;
00483   double **t_coeff;
00484   double **p_coeff;
00485   int     *outliers;
00486   double   aux,value;
00487   double  *x;
00488   double **v_mat;
00489   double  *singular_values;
00490   int      n_outliers;
00491   double  *ss_inputs;
00492 
00493   Regression_Statistics *stat;
00494 
00495   /* allocate memory */
00496 
00497   XTX   = my_matrix(1,n_in,1,n_in);
00498   P     = my_matrix(1,n_in,1,n_in);
00499   XTY   = my_matrix(1,n_in,1,n_out);
00500   beta  = my_matrix(1,n_in,1,n_out);
00501   Yp    = my_matrix(1,n_out,1,n_pts);
00502   res   = my_matrix(1,n_out,1,n_pts);
00503 
00504   sum_outputs    = my_vector(1,n_out);
00505   sum_residuals  = my_vector(1,n_out);
00506   sum_regression = my_vector(1,n_out);
00507   mean_outputs    = my_vector(1,n_out);
00508   mean_residuals  = my_vector(1,n_out);
00509   mean_regression = my_vector(1,n_out);
00510   var_outputs    = my_vector(1,n_out);
00511   var_residuals  = my_vector(1,n_out);
00512   var_regression = my_vector(1,n_out);
00513 
00514   r_squared = my_vector(1,n_out);
00515   r_squared_adj = my_vector(1,n_out);
00516 
00517   f_reg = my_vector(1,n_out);
00518   p_reg = my_vector(1,n_out);
00519 
00520   var_coeff  = my_matrix(1,n_in,1,n_out);
00521   std_coeff  = my_matrix(1,n_in,1,n_out);
00522   t_coeff    = my_matrix(1,n_in,1,n_out);
00523   p_coeff    = my_matrix(1,n_in,1,n_out);
00524 
00525   outliers = my_ivector(1,n_pts);
00526 
00527   x = my_vector(1,n_in);
00528 
00529   v_mat = my_matrix(1,n_in,1,n_in);
00530   singular_values = my_vector(1,n_in);
00531   ss_inputs = my_vector(1,n_in);
00532 
00533 
00534   /******************************************************************/
00535   /* the regression calculation                                     */
00536   /******************************************************************/
00537   
00538   /* build the XTX matrix */
00539 
00540   for (n=1; n<=n_in; ++n) {
00541     for (m=n; m<=n_in; ++m) {
00542       XTX[n][m] = 0.0;
00543       for (i=1; i<=n_pts; ++i) {
00544         XTX[n][m] += XX[n][i]*XX[m][i];
00545       }
00546       XTX[m][n] = XTX[n][m];
00547     }
00548   }
00549 
00550   /* build the XTY matrix */
00551 
00552   for (n=1; n<=n_in; ++n) {
00553     for (m=1; m<=n_out; ++m) {
00554       XTY[n][m] = 0.0;
00555       for (i=1; i<=n_pts; ++i) {
00556         XTY[n][m] += XX[n][i]*YY[m][i];
00557       }
00558     }
00559   }
00560 
00561 
00562   /* invert the XTX matrix */
00563 
00564   my_inv_ludcmp(XTX, n_in, P);
00565 
00566   /* make sure P is symmetric */
00567 
00568   for (n=1; n<=n_in; ++n) {
00569     for (m=n+1; m<=n_in; ++m) {
00570       P[m][n] = P[n][m];
00571     }
00572   }
00573 
00574   /* get the regression parameters */
00575 
00576   mat_mult(P,XTY,beta);
00577 
00578 
00579 
00580   /******************************************************************/
00581   /* the regression statistics                                      */
00582   /******************************************************************/
00583   
00584   /* calculate the predicted values and the residuals */
00585 
00586   for (m=1; m<=n_out; ++m) {
00587     for (i=1; i<=n_pts; ++i) {
00588       Yp[m][i] = 0.0;
00589       for (n=1; n<=n_in; ++n) {
00590         Yp[m][i] += XX[n][i]*beta[n][m];
00591       }
00592       res[m][i] = YY[m][i] - Yp[m][i];
00593     }
00594   }
00595 
00596 
00597   /* calculate the sum of outputs, regression, and residuals */
00598 
00599   for (m=1; m<=n_out; ++m) {
00600     sum_outputs[m] = 0.0;
00601     sum_residuals[m] = 0.0;
00602     sum_regression[m] = 0.0;
00603     for (i=1; i<=n_pts; ++i) {
00604       sum_outputs[m] += YY[m][i];
00605       sum_regression[m] += Yp[m][i];
00606       sum_residuals[m] += res[m][i];
00607     }
00608   }
00609   
00610   /* the means of these values */
00611 
00612   for (m=1; m<=n_out; ++m) {
00613     mean_outputs[m]    = sum_outputs[m]/(double)n_pts;
00614     mean_residuals[m]  = sum_residuals[m]/(double)n_pts;
00615     mean_regression[m] = sum_regression[m]/(double)n_pts;
00616   }
00617 
00618 
00619   /* the variances of these values */
00620                              
00621   for (m=1; m<=n_out; ++m) {
00622     sum_outputs[m] = 0.0;
00623     sum_residuals[m] = 0.0;
00624     sum_regression[m] = 0.0;
00625     for (i=1; i<=n_pts; ++i) {
00626       sum_outputs[m] += sqr(YY[m][i]-mean_outputs[m]);;
00627       sum_regression[m] += sqr(Yp[m][i]-mean_regression[m]);
00628       sum_residuals[m] += sqr(res[m][i]-mean_residuals[m]);
00629     }
00630   }
00631 
00632   for (m=1; m<=n_out; ++m) {
00633     var_outputs[m]    = sum_outputs[m]/(double)(n_pts-1);
00634     var_residuals[m]  = sum_residuals[m]/(double)(n_pts-n_in);
00635     var_regression[m] = sum_regression[m]/(double)(n_in-1);
00636   }
00637 
00638   /******************************************************************/
00639   /* the r-squared values                                           */
00640   /******************************************************************/
00641 
00642   r_squared_total = 0.0;
00643   r_squared_adj_total = 0.0;
00644 
00645   for (m=1; m<=n_out; ++m) {
00646 
00647     r_squared[m] = (var_outputs[m]*(double)(n_pts-1) -
00648       var_residuals[m]*(double)(n_pts-n_in)) /
00649       (var_outputs[m]*(double)(n_pts-1));
00650 
00651     r_squared_adj[m] = (var_outputs[m] - var_residuals[m]) /
00652       (var_outputs[m]);
00653 
00654     r_squared_total += r_squared[m];
00655     r_squared_adj_total += r_squared_adj[m];
00656     
00657   }  
00658 
00659   r_squared_total /= (double)n_out;
00660   r_squared_adj_total /= (double)n_out;
00661   
00662   
00663   /******************************************************************/
00664   /* the F-test of the total regression                             */
00665   /******************************************************************/
00666 
00667   f_reg_total = 0;
00668   p_reg_total = 0;
00669 
00670   for (m = 1; m<=n_out; ++m) {
00671 
00672     f_reg[m] = var_regression[m] / var_residuals[m];
00673     p_reg[m] = prob_f(f_reg[m], (double)(n_in-1), (double)(n_pts-n_in));
00674 
00675     f_reg_total += f_reg[m];
00676     p_reg_total += p_reg[m];
00677 
00678   }
00679 
00680   f_reg_total /= (double) n_out;
00681   p_reg_total /= (double) n_out;
00682 
00683 
00684   /******************************************************************/
00685   /* the t-test of the regression coefficients                      */
00686   /******************************************************************/
00687   
00688   for (m=1; m <= n_out; ++m) {
00689     for (n=1; n <= n_in; ++n) {
00690       var_coeff[n][m] = var_residuals[m] * P[n][n];
00691       std_coeff[n][m] = sqrt(var_coeff[n][m]);
00692       t_coeff[n][m]   = beta[n][m] / std_coeff[n][m];
00693       p_coeff[n][m]   = 1.-prob_t(t_coeff[n][m], (double)(n_pts-n_in));
00694     }
00695   }
00696 
00697 
00698   /******************************************************************/
00699   /* outlier detection                                              */
00700   /******************************************************************/
00701   
00702 
00703   /* calculate the standarized PRESS residual */
00704 
00705   n_outliers = 0;
00706 
00707   for (i=1; i<=n_pts; ++i) {
00708 
00709     for (n=1; n<=n_in; ++n) {
00710       x[n] = XX[n][i];
00711     }
00712     aux = sqrt(1.-mat_mahal(P,x));
00713 
00714     outliers[i] = FALSE;
00715 
00716     for (m=1; m<=n_out; ++m) {
00717       value = fabs(res[m][i]/sqrt(var_residuals[m])/aux);
00718       if (value > outlier_threshold) {
00719         outliers[i] = TRUE;
00720       }
00721     }
00722     
00723     if (outliers[i]) outliers[++n_outliers] = i;
00724 
00725   }
00726 
00727 
00728   /******************************************************************/
00729   /* singular value decomposition                                   */
00730   /******************************************************************/
00731 
00732   /* scale XTX for this purpose */
00733 
00734   for (n=1; n<=n_in; ++n) {
00735     ss_inputs[n] = 0.0;
00736     for (i=1; i<=n_pts; ++i) {
00737       ss_inputs[n] += sqr(XX[n][i]);
00738     }
00739   }
00740   
00741   for (n=1; n<=n_in; ++n) {
00742     for (m=1; m<=n_in; ++m) {
00743       XTX[n][m] /= sqrt(ss_inputs[n])*sqrt(ss_inputs[m]);
00744     }
00745   }
00746 
00747   my_svdcmp(XTX,n_in,n_in,singular_values,v_mat);
00748 
00749 
00750   /******************************************************************/
00751   /* sort everything in the statistics structure                    */
00752   /******************************************************************/
00753  
00754   stat = my_calloc(1,sizeof(Regression_Statistics),MY_STOP);
00755 
00756   stat->n_in  = n_in;
00757   stat->n_out = n_out;
00758   stat->n_pts = n_pts;
00759   stat->outlier_threshold = outlier_threshold;
00760   stat->beta  = beta;
00761   stat->var_residuals = var_residuals;
00762   stat->var_outputs = var_outputs;
00763   stat->r_squared = r_squared;
00764   stat->r_squared_adj = r_squared_adj;
00765   stat->f_reg = f_reg;
00766   stat->p_reg = p_reg;
00767   stat->var_coeff = var_coeff;
00768   stat->std_coeff = std_coeff;
00769   stat->t_coeff = t_coeff;
00770   stat->p_coeff = p_coeff;
00771   stat->outliers = outliers;
00772   stat->n_outliers = n_outliers;
00773   stat->sv = singular_values;
00774 
00775 
00776   /* free memory */
00777 
00778   my_free_matrix(XTX,1,n_in,1,n_in);
00779   my_free_matrix(P,1,n_in,1,n_in);
00780   my_free_matrix(XTY,1,n_in,1,n_out);
00781   my_free_matrix(Yp,1,n_out,1,n_pts);
00782   my_free_matrix(res,1,n_out,1,n_pts);
00783 
00784   my_free_vector(sum_outputs,1,n_out);
00785   my_free_vector(sum_residuals,1,n_out);
00786   my_free_vector(sum_regression,1,n_out);
00787   my_free_vector(mean_outputs,1,n_out);
00788   my_free_vector(mean_residuals,1,n_out);
00789   my_free_vector(mean_regression,1,n_out);
00790   my_free_vector(var_regression,1,n_out);
00791   my_free_vector(x,1,n_in);
00792 
00793   my_free_matrix(v_mat,1,n_in,1,n_in);
00794   my_free_vector(ss_inputs,1,n_in);
00795 
00796   return stat;
00797 
00798 }
00799 
00800 /*!*****************************************************************************
00801  *******************************************************************************
00802 \note  printRegressionStatistics
00803 \date  December 1995
00804    
00805 \remarks 
00806 
00807         dumps the regression statistics to a file
00808 
00809  *******************************************************************************
00810  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00811 
00812  \param[in]     stat      : pointer to regression statistics
00813  \param[in]     fp        : pointer to output channel
00814  \param[in]     name      : a name attached to this output
00815 
00816  ******************************************************************************/
00817 int
00818 printRegressionStatistics(Regression_Statistics *stat,FILE *fp, char *name)
00819 
00820 {
00821 
00822   FILE *out;
00823   int   i,j,k,m,n,r;
00824   double maxsv,minsv;
00825 
00826   fprintf(fp,"\n================================================\n");
00827   fprintf(fp,"STATISTICS OF >%s< FIT:\n",name);
00828   fprintf(fp,"================================================\n\n");
00829   
00830   fprintf(fp,"n_in=%d  n_out=%d  n_data=%d\n\n",
00831           stat->n_in,stat->n_out,stat->n_pts);
00832 
00833   fprintf(fp,"R-Square:\n");
00834   for (i=1; i <= stat->n_out; ++i) {
00835     fprintf(fp,"         %d.Output: %8.4f\n", i, stat->r_squared[i]);
00836   }
00837   fprintf(fp,"\n");
00838   
00839   fprintf(fp,"Adjusted R-Square:\n");
00840   for (i = 1; i <= stat->n_out; ++i) {
00841     fprintf(fp,"         %d.Output: %8.4f\n", i,stat->r_squared_adj[i]);
00842   }
00843   fprintf(fp,"\n");
00844   
00845   fprintf(fp,"Total Regression Statistics:\n");
00846   for (i = 1; i <= stat->n_out; ++i) {
00847     fprintf(fp,"%d.Output: var_out=%8.4f  var_res=%8.4f  F-test=%8.4f  p=%8.4f\n", i,
00848             stat->var_outputs[i],
00849             stat->var_residuals[i],
00850             stat->f_reg[i],
00851             stat->p_reg[i]);
00852   }
00853   fprintf(fp,"\n");
00854   
00855   fprintf(fp,"Statistics for Regression Coefficients:\n");
00856   
00857   for (i = 1; i <= stat->n_out; ++i) {
00858     for (m = 1; m <= stat->n_in; ++m) {
00859       fprintf(fp,"%d.%d  coeff=%8.4f  var=%8.4f  std_err=%8.4f  t=%8.4f  p=%8.4f\n", i, m,
00860               stat->beta[m][i],
00861               stat->var_coeff[m][i],
00862               stat->std_coeff[m][i],
00863               stat->t_coeff[m][i],
00864               stat->p_coeff[m][i]);
00865     }
00866     fprintf(fp,"\n");
00867   }
00868   fprintf(fp,"\n");
00869 
00870   
00871   maxsv = -1.e30;
00872   minsv =  1.e30;
00873   fprintf(fp,"Singular Values of **Scaled** Regression Matrix\n");
00874   for (r = 1; r <= stat->n_in; ++r) {
00875     fprintf(fp,"%d.SV:     %8.4f\n",r,stat->sv[r]);
00876     if (maxsv < stat->sv[r]) maxsv = stat->sv[r];
00877     if (minsv > stat->sv[r]) minsv = stat->sv[r];
00878   }
00879   fprintf(fp,"Condition Number: %g\n",maxsv/minsv);
00880       
00881   
00882   if (stat->n_outliers == 0) {
00883     
00884     fprintf(fp,"\nNo outliers detected!\n");
00885     
00886   } else {
00887 
00888     fprintf(fp,"\nThe following points are outliers, threshold=%7.4f:\n",
00889             stat->outlier_threshold);
00890     for (i=1; i<=stat->n_outliers; ++i) {
00891       fprintf(fp,"%d ",stat->outliers[i]);
00892       if (i%10 == 0) fprintf(fp,"\n");
00893     }
00894     fprintf(fp,"\n");
00895   }
00896   
00897   fprintf(fp,"\n\n");
00898 
00899   return TRUE;
00900   
00901 }
00902       
00903 /*!*****************************************************************************
00904  *******************************************************************************
00905 \note  predictRLS
00906 \date  September 2006
00907    
00908 \remarks 
00909 
00910         performs a prediction with RLS structure
00911 
00912  *******************************************************************************
00913  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00914 
00915  \param[in]     rls        : data structure of rls
00916  \param[in]     n_data_min : minumum data in RLS to perform prediction
00917  \param[in]     x          : input data vector (without constant)
00918  \param[out]    y          : output data vector
00919 
00920  ******************************************************************************/
00921 int
00922 predictRLS(RLSStatisticsPtr rls, int n_data_min, double *x, double *y)
00923 {
00924   int     i,j;
00925 
00926   // check for sufficient data
00927   if (rls->n_data < n_data_min)
00928     return FALSE;
00929 
00930   // compute the output
00931   for (j=1; j<=rls->n_out; ++j)
00932     if (rls->add_constant)
00933       y[j] = rls->beta[rls->n_in][j];
00934     else
00935       y[j] = 0.0;
00936     
00937   for (j=1; j<=rls->n_out; ++j)
00938     if (rls->add_constant)
00939       for (i=1; i<=rls->n_in-1; ++i)
00940         y[j] += rls->beta[i][j] * x[i];
00941     else
00942       for (i=1; i<=rls->n_in; ++i)
00943         y[j] += rls->beta[i][j] * x[i];
00944 
00945   return TRUE;
00946 }
00947 
00948 /*!*****************************************************************************
00949  *******************************************************************************
00950 \note  recursiveLeastSquares
00951 \date  September 2006
00952    
00953 \remarks 
00954 
00955         performs recursive least squares with forgetting factor and
00956         weight
00957 
00958  *******************************************************************************
00959  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00960 
00961  \param[in,out] rls        : data structure of rls
00962  \param[in]     x          : input data vector (without constant)
00963  \param[in]     y          : output data vector
00964  \param[in]     w          : weight of this data point
00965 
00966  ******************************************************************************/
00967 void
00968 recursiveLeastSquares(RLSStatisticsPtr rls, double *x, double *y, double w)
00969 {
00970   int    i,j;
00971   double xPx;
00972   double denom;
00973 
00974   // assign inputs and outputs to local data structures
00975   if (rls->add_constant) {
00976     for (i=1; i<=rls->n_in-1; ++i)
00977       rls->x[i] = x[i];
00978     rls->x[rls->n_in] = 1;
00979   } else {
00980     for (i=1; i<=rls->n_in; ++i)
00981       rls->x[i] = x[i];
00982   }
00983 
00984   for (i=1; i<=rls->n_out; ++i)
00985     rls->y[i] = y[i];
00986 
00987   // compute Px term
00988   mat_vec_mult(rls->P,rls->x,rls->Px);
00989 
00990   // compute xPx term
00991   xPx = vec_mult_inner(rls->x,rls->Px);
00992   denom = rls->lambda/w + xPx;
00993 
00994   // compute the entire P update
00995   for (i=1; i<=rls->n_in; ++i) {
00996     for (j=i; j<=rls->n_in; ++j) {
00997       rls->P[i][j] = (rls->P[i][j] - rls->Px[i]*rls->Px[j]/denom)/rls->lambda;
00998     }
00999   }
01000 
01001   // compute regression update
01002   mat_vec_mult(rls->P,rls->x,rls->Px);
01003   vec_mat_mult(rls->x,rls->beta,rls->pred);
01004   vec_sub(rls->y,rls->pred,rls->error);
01005 
01006   for (i=1; i<=rls->n_in; ++i) {
01007     for (j=1; j<=rls->n_out; ++j) {
01008       rls->beta[i][j] = rls->beta[i][j] + w*rls->Px[i]*rls->error[j];
01009     }
01010   }
01011 
01012   // update some statistics
01013   vec_mat_mult(rls->x,rls->beta,rls->pred);
01014   vec_sub(rls->y,rls->pred,rls->error);
01015 
01016   rls->n_data = rls->lambda*rls->n_data + 1;
01017   rls->nMSE   = 0;
01018   for (i=1; i<=rls->n_out; ++i) {
01019     rls->sum_error2[i] = rls->sum_error2[i]*rls->lambda + sqr(rls->error[i]);
01020     rls->sum_y[i]      = rls->sum_y[i]*rls->lambda + y[i];
01021     rls->sum_y2[i]     = rls->sum_y2[i]*rls->lambda + sqr(y[i]);
01022     rls->nMSE         += rls->sum_error2[i]/
01023       (rls->sum_y2[i] - sqr(rls->sum_y[i])/rls->n_data + 1.e-10);
01024   }
01025   rls->nMSE /= (double)rls->n_out;
01026 
01027 }
01028 
01029 /*!*****************************************************************************
01030  *******************************************************************************
01031 \note  initRecursiveLeastSquares
01032 \date  September 2006
01033    
01034 \remarks 
01035 
01036         initializes a rls data structure and allocates all memory
01037 
01038  *******************************************************************************
01039  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
01040 
01041  \param[in]     n_in         : number of inputs (without constant)
01042  \param[in]     n_out        : number of outputs 
01043  \param[in]     add_constant : TRUE/FALSE to add constant to inputs
01044  \param[in]     ridge        : ridge factor
01045  \param[in]     lambda       : forgetting factor
01046  \param[in]     name         : name of rls model
01047 
01048  ******************************************************************************/
01049 RLSStatisticsPtr
01050 initRecursiveLeastSquares(int n_in, int n_out, int add_constant, 
01051                           double ridge, double lambda, char *name)
01052 {
01053   int i;
01054   RLSStatisticsPtr rls;
01055 
01056   if (add_constant)
01057     ++n_in;
01058 
01059   // get data structure and memory
01060   rls       = (RLSStatisticsPtr) my_calloc(1,sizeof(RLSStatistics),MY_STOP);
01061   rls->P    = my_matrix_symm(1,n_in,1,n_in);
01062   rls->beta = my_matrix(1,n_in,1,n_out);
01063   rls->Px   = my_vector(1,n_in);
01064   rls->x    = my_vector(1,n_in);
01065   rls->y    = my_vector(1,n_out);
01066   rls->pred = my_vector(1,n_out);
01067   rls->error= my_vector(1,n_out);
01068 
01069   rls->sum_error2= my_vector(1,n_out);
01070   rls->sum_y2    = my_vector(1,n_out);
01071   rls->sum_y     = my_vector(1,n_out);
01072 
01073   // assign variables
01074   rls->n_in         = n_in;
01075   rls->n_out        = n_out;
01076   rls->ridge        = ridge;
01077   rls->add_constant = add_constant;
01078   rls->lambda       = lambda;
01079   rls->n_data       = 0;
01080   strcpy(rls->name,name);
01081 
01082   for (i=1; i<=n_in; ++i)
01083     rls->P[i][i] = 1./(ridge+1.e-10);
01084 
01085   return rls;
01086 }
01087 
01088 /*!*****************************************************************************
01089  *******************************************************************************
01090 \note  writeRLS
01091 \date  September 2006
01092    
01093 \remarks 
01094 
01095         write the given RLS to file
01096 
01097  *******************************************************************************
01098  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
01099 
01100  \param[in]     rls      : data structure of rls
01101 
01102  ******************************************************************************/
01103 int
01104 writeRLS(RLSStatisticsPtr rls)
01105 {
01106   FILE *out;
01107   char  name[100];
01108 
01109   sprintf(name,"%s.rls",rls->name);
01110   out = fopen(name,"w");
01111   if (out == NULL) {
01112     printf("Cannot open file >%s< for write\n",name);
01113     return FALSE;
01114   }
01115   
01116   printf("Writing to file >%s< ...",name);
01117 
01118   // the defining main structure
01119   if (fwrite(rls,sizeof(RLSStatistics),1,out)!= 1) {
01120     printf( "cannot fwrite file.\n" );
01121     return FALSE;
01122   }
01123 
01124   // now all the matrices and vectors
01125   fwrite_mat(out,rls->P);
01126   fwrite_mat(out,rls->beta);
01127   fwrite_vec(out,rls->sum_error2);
01128   fwrite_vec(out,rls->sum_y2);
01129   fwrite_vec(out,rls->sum_y);
01130 
01131   fclose(out);
01132 
01133   printf("done\n");
01134 
01135   return TRUE;
01136 
01137 }
01138 
01139 /*!*****************************************************************************
01140  *******************************************************************************
01141 \note  readRLS
01142 \date  September 2006
01143    
01144 \remarks 
01145 
01146         read the given RLS from file
01147 
01148  *******************************************************************************
01149  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
01150 
01151  \param[in]     rls      : data structure of rls
01152 
01153  ******************************************************************************/
01154 RLSStatisticsPtr
01155 readRLS(char *name)
01156 {
01157   FILE *in;
01158   char  fname[100];
01159   RLSStatistics    rls;
01160   RLSStatisticsPtr rls_ptr;
01161 
01162   sprintf(fname,"%s.rls",name);
01163   in = fopen(fname,"r");
01164   if (in == NULL) {
01165     printf("Cannot open file >%s< for read\n",fname);
01166     return NULL;
01167   }
01168   
01169   printf("Reading file >%s< ...",fname);
01170 
01171   // the defining main structure
01172   if (fread(&rls,sizeof(RLSStatistics),1,in)!= 1) {
01173     printf( "cannot fread file.\n" );
01174     return NULL;
01175   }
01176 
01177   if (rls.add_constant == 1)
01178     --rls.n_in;
01179 
01180   rls_ptr = initRecursiveLeastSquares(rls.n_in, rls.n_out, rls.add_constant, 
01181                                       rls.ridge, rls.lambda, rls.name);
01182   
01183   // now all the matrices and vectors
01184   fread_mat(in,rls_ptr->P);
01185   fread_mat(in,rls_ptr->beta);
01186   fread_vec(in,rls_ptr->sum_error2);
01187   fread_vec(in,rls_ptr->sum_y2);
01188   fread_vec(in,rls_ptr->sum_y);
01189 
01190   rls_ptr->nMSE = rls.nMSE;
01191   rls_ptr->n_data = rls.n_data;
01192 
01193   fclose(in);
01194 
01195   printf("done\n");
01196 
01197   return rls_ptr;
01198 
01199 }

01201 /*!*****************************************************************************
01202  *******************************************************************************
01203 \note  initHistogram
01204 \date  September 2006
01205    
01206 \remarks 
01207 
01208         initializes a 1D histogram
01209 
01210  *******************************************************************************
01211  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
01212 
01213  \param[in]     min          : min value of histogram bins
01214  \param[in]     max          : max value of histogram bins
01215  \param[in]     n_bins       : the number of bins in histogram
01216  \param[in]     lambda       : forgetting factor
01217  \param[in]     name         : name of rls model
01218 
01219  ******************************************************************************/
01220 HistogramStatisticsPtr
01221 initHistogram(double min, double max, int n_bins,
01222               double lambda, char *name)
01223 {
01224   int i;
01225   HistogramStatisticsPtr hist;
01226 
01227   // get data structure and memory
01228   hist         = (HistogramStatisticsPtr) my_calloc(1,sizeof(HistogramStatistics),MY_STOP);
01229   hist->min    = min;
01230   hist->max    = max;
01231   hist->n_bins = n_bins;
01232   hist->lambda = lambda;
01233   hist->n_data = 0;
01234   strcpy(hist->name,name);
01235 
01236   hist->n_data_bin  = my_vector(1,n_bins);
01237   hist->n_success   = my_vector(1,n_bins);
01238   hist->p           = my_vector(1,n_bins);
01239 
01240   for (i=1; i<=n_bins; ++i)
01241     hist->p[i] = 0.5;
01242 
01243   return hist;
01244 }
01245 
01246 /*!*****************************************************************************
01247  *******************************************************************************
01248 \note  writeHistogram
01249 \date  September 2006
01250    
01251 \remarks 
01252 
01253         write the given histogram to file
01254 
01255  *******************************************************************************
01256  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
01257 
01258  \param[in]     hist      : data structure of histogram
01259 
01260  ******************************************************************************/
01261 int
01262 writeHistogram(HistogramStatisticsPtr hist)
01263 {
01264   FILE *out;
01265   char  name[100];
01266 
01267   sprintf(name,"%s.hist",hist->name);
01268   out = fopen(name,"w");
01269   if (out == NULL) {
01270     printf("Cannot open file >%s< for write\n",name);
01271     return FALSE;
01272   }
01273   
01274   printf("Writing to file >%s< ...",name);
01275 
01276   // the defining main structure
01277   if (fwrite(hist,sizeof(HistogramStatistics),1,out)!= 1) {
01278     printf( "cannot fwrite file.\n" );
01279     return FALSE;
01280   }
01281 
01282   // now all the matrices and vectors
01283   fwrite_vec(out,hist->n_data_bin);
01284   fwrite_vec(out,hist->n_success);
01285   fwrite_vec(out,hist->p);
01286 
01287   fclose(out);
01288 
01289   printf("done\n");
01290 
01291   return TRUE;
01292 
01293 }
01294 
01295 /*!*****************************************************************************
01296  *******************************************************************************
01297 \note  readHistogram
01298 \date  September 2006
01299    
01300 \remarks 
01301 
01302         read the given Histogram from file
01303 
01304  *******************************************************************************
01305  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
01306 
01307  \param[in]     name      : name of the histogram file (without .hist suffix)
01308 
01309  ******************************************************************************/
01310 HistogramStatisticsPtr
01311 readHistogram(char *name)
01312 {
01313   FILE *in;
01314   char  fname[100];
01315   HistogramStatistics    hist;
01316   HistogramStatisticsPtr hist_ptr;
01317 
01318   sprintf(fname,"%s.hist",name);
01319   in = fopen(fname,"r");
01320   if (in == NULL) {
01321     printf("Cannot open file >%s< for read\n",fname);
01322     return NULL;
01323   }
01324   
01325   printf("Reading file >%s< ...",fname);
01326 
01327   // the defining main structure
01328   if (fread(&hist,sizeof(HistogramStatistics),1,in)!= 1) {
01329     printf( "cannot fread file.\n" );
01330     return NULL;
01331   }
01332 
01333   hist_ptr = initHistogram(hist.min, hist.max, hist.n_bins,
01334                            hist.lambda, hist.name);
01335   
01336   // now all the matrices and vectors
01337   fread_vec(in,hist_ptr->n_data_bin);
01338   fread_vec(in,hist_ptr->n_success);
01339   fread_vec(in,hist_ptr->p);
01340 
01341   // copy constant values
01342   hist_ptr->n_data = hist.n_data;
01343 
01344   fclose(in);
01345 
01346   printf("done\n");
01347 
01348   return hist_ptr;
01349 
01350 }
01351 
01352 /*!*****************************************************************************
01353  *******************************************************************************
01354 \note  histogramClassifier
01355 \date  September 2006
01356    
01357 \remarks 
01358 
01359         a 1D histogram classifier
01360 
01361  *******************************************************************************
01362  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
01363 
01364  \param[in,out] hist       : data structure of histogram
01365  \param[in]     x          : input data 
01366  \param[in]     s          : s >= 0.5 success, s < 0.5 failure
01367  \param[in]     w          : weight of this data point
01368 
01369  ******************************************************************************/
01370 void
01371 histogramClassifier(HistogramStatisticsPtr hist, double x, double s, double w)
01372 {
01373   int    i,j;
01374   double delta;
01375   int    n;
01376 
01377   // determine into which bin x falls
01378   delta = (hist->max - hist->min)/(double)hist->n_bins;
01379   n = (int) rint((x - hist->min)/delta);
01380   if (n < 1)
01381     n = 1;
01382   if (n > hist->n_bins)
01383     n = hist->n_bins;
01384 
01385   // update the statistics of this bin
01386   if ( s > 0.5) 
01387     s = 1.0;
01388   else
01389     s = 0.0;
01390 
01391   hist->n_data_bin[n]= hist->n_data_bin[n] * hist->lambda + w;
01392   hist->n_success[n] = hist->n_success[n] * hist->lambda + s*w;
01393   hist->p[n]         = hist->n_success[n]/hist->n_data_bin[n];
01394 
01395   ++hist->n_data;
01396 
01397 }
01398 
01399 /*!*****************************************************************************
01400  *******************************************************************************
01401 \note  predictHistogram
01402 \date  September 2006
01403    
01404 \remarks 
01405 
01406         performs a prediction with the Histogram structure and neighborhood
01407         smoothing
01408 
01409  *******************************************************************************
01410  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
01411 
01412  \param[in]     hist       : data structure of histogram
01413  \param[in]     n_data_min : minumum data in bin to perform prediction
01414  \param[in]     n_neigbors : average over how many neighbor bins?
01415  \param[in]     x          : input data point
01416  \param[out]    y          : output (probability of success)
01417 
01418  ******************************************************************************/
01419 int
01420 predictHistogram(HistogramStatisticsPtr hist, int n_data_min, 
01421                  int n_neighbors, double x, double *y)
01422 {
01423   int     i,j;
01424   double delta;
01425   int    n;
01426   double sum_w;
01427   double sum_data;
01428   double sum_data_bin;
01429   int    sn,en;
01430   double w;
01431 
01432   // check for sufficient data
01433   if (hist->n_data < n_data_min) {
01434     *y = 0.5;
01435     return FALSE;
01436   }
01437 
01438   // determine into which bin x falls
01439   delta = (hist->max - hist->min)/(double)hist->n_bins;
01440   n = (int) rint((x - hist->min)/delta);
01441   if (n < 1)
01442     n = 1;
01443   if (n > hist->n_bins)
01444     n = hist->n_bins;
01445 
01446   sn = n - n_neighbors;
01447   if (sn < 1)
01448     sn = 1;
01449   en = n + n_neighbors;
01450   if (en > hist->n_bins)
01451     en = hist->n_bins;
01452 
01453   sum_w        = 1.e-10;
01454   sum_data     = 0.0;
01455   sum_data_bin = 0.0;
01456   for (i=sn; i<=en; ++i) {
01457     w = ((n_neighbors - abs(n-i)) * 2.0 + 1)*hist->n_data_bin[i];
01458     sum_w += w;
01459     sum_data += hist->p[i] * w;
01460     sum_data_bin += hist->n_data_bin[i] * w;
01461   }
01462 
01463   // check for sufficient data in bin
01464   if (sum_data_bin/sum_w < n_data_min || sum_w == 0.0) {
01465     *y = 0.5;
01466     return FALSE;
01467   }
01468 
01469   *y = sum_data/sum_w;
01470   return TRUE;
01471 
01472 }

00566 00567 /* make sure P is symmetric */ 00568 00569 for (n=1; n<=n_in; ++n) { 00570 for (m=n+1; m<=n_in; ++m) { 00571 P[m][n] = P[n][m]; 00572 } 00573 } 00574 00575 /* get the regression parameters */ 00576 00577 mat_mult(P,XTY,beta); 00578 00579 00580 00581 /******************************************************************/ 00582 /* the regression statistics */ 00583 /******************************************************************/ 00584 00585 /* calculate the predicted values and the residuals */ 00586 00587 for (m=1; 00725 00726 } 00727 00728 00729 /******************************************************************/ 00730 /* singular value decomposition */ 00731 /******************************************************************/ 00732 00733 /* scale XTX for this purpose */ 00734 00735 for (n=1; 00745 } 00746 } 00747 00748 my_svdcmp(XTX,n_in,n_in,singular_values,v_mat); 00749 00750 00751 /******************************************************************/ 00752 /* sort everything in the statistics structure */ 00753 /******************************************************************/ 00754 00755 stat = my_calloc(1,sizeof(Regression_Statistics),MY_STOP); 00763 stat->var_outputs = var_outputs; 00764 stat->r_squared = r_squared; 00765 stat->r_squared_adj = r_squared_adj; 00766 stat->f_reg = f_reg; 00767 stat->p_reg = p_reg; 00768 stat->var_coeff = var_coeff; 00783 my_free_matrix(res,1,n_out,1,n_pts); 00784 00785 my_free_vector(sum_outputs,1,n_out); 00786 my_free_vector(sum_residuals,1,n_out); 00787 my_free_vector(sum_regression,1,n_out); 00788 my_free_vector(mean_outputs,1,n_out); 00789 my_free_vector(mean_residuals,1,n_out); 00790 my_free_vector(mean_regression,1,n_out); 00791 my_free_vector(var_regression,1,n_out); 00792 my_free_vector(x,1,n_in); 00793 00794 my_free_matrix(v_mat,1,n_in,1,n_in); 00795 my_free_vector(ss_inputs,1,n_in); 00796 00797 return stat; 00798 00799 } 00800 00801 /*!***************************************************************************** 00802 ******************************************************************************* 00803 \note printRegressionStatistics 00804 \date December 1995 00805 00806 \remarks 00807 00808 dumps the regression statistics to a file 00809 00810 ******************************************************************************* 00811 Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output 00812 00813 \param[in] stat : pointer to regression statistics 00814 \param[in] fp : pointer to output channel 00815 \param[in] name : a name attached to this output 00816 00817 ******************************************************************************/ 00818 int 00819 printRegressionStatistics(Regression_Statistics *stat,FILE *fp, char *name) 00820 00821 { 00822 00823 FILE *out; 00837 } 00838 fprintf(fp,"\n"); 00839 00840 fprintf(fp,"Adjusted R-Square:\n"); 00841 for (i = 1; i <= stat->n_out; ++i) { 00842 fprintf(fp," %d.Output: %8.4f\n", i,stat->r_squared_adj[i]); 00843 } 00844 fprintf(fp,"\n"); 00845 00846 fprintf(fp,"Total Regression Statistics:\n"); 00847 for (i = 1; i <= stat->n_out; ++i) { 00848 fprintf(fp,"%d.Output: var_out=%8.4f var_res=%8.4f F-test=%8.4f p=%8.4f\n", i, 00849 stat->var_outputs[i], 00850 stat->var_residuals[i], 00851 stat->f_reg[i], 00852 stat->p_reg[i]); 00853 } 00854 fprintf(fp,"\n"); 00855 00856 fprintf(fp,"Statistics for Regression Coefficients:\n"); 00857 00858 for (i = 1; i <= stat->n_out; ++i) { 00859 for (m = 1; m <= stat->n_in; ++m) { 00860 fprintf(fp,"%d.%d coeff=%8.4f var=%8.4f std_err=%8.4f t=%8.4f p=%8.4f\n", i, m, 00861 stat->beta[m][i], 00862 stat->var_coeff[m][i], 00863 stat->std_coeff[m][i], 00864 stat->t_coeff[m][i], 00865 stat->p_coeff[m][i]); 00866 } 00867 fprintf(fp,"\n"); 00868 } 00869 fprintf(fp,"\n"); 00870 00871 00872 maxsv = -1.e30; 00873 minsv = 1.e30; 00874 fprintf(fp,"Singular Values of **Scaled** Regression Matrix\n"); 00875 for (r = 1; 00891 for (i=1; i<=stat->n_outliers; ++i) { 00892 fprintf(fp,"%d ",stat->outliers[i]); 00893 if (i%10 == 0) fprintf(fp,"\n"); 00894 } 00895 fprintf(fp,"\n"); 00896 } 00897 00898 fprintf(fp,"\n\n"); 00899 00900 return TRUE; 00901 00902 } 00903 00904 /*!***************************************************************************** 00905 ******************************************************************************* 00906 \note predictRLS 00907 \date September 2006 00908 00909 \remarks 00910 00911 performs a prediction with RLS structure 00912 00913 ******************************************************************************* 00914 Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output 00915 00916 \param[in] rls : data structure of rls 00917 \param[in] n_data_min : minumum data in RLS to perform prediction 00918 \param[in] x : input data vector (without constant) 00919 \param[out] y : output data vector 00920 00921 ******************************************************************************/ 00922 int 00923 predictRLS(RLSStatisticsPtr rls, int n_data_min, double *x, double *y) 00924 { 00925 int i,j; 00926 00927 // check for sufficient data 00928 if (rls->n_data < n_data_min) 00929 return FALSE; 00930 00931 // compute the output 00932 for (j=1; j<=rls->n_out; ++j) 00933 if (rls->add_constant) 00934 y[j] = rls->beta[rls->n_in][j]; 00935 else 00936 y[j] = 0.0; 00937 00938 for (j=1; j<=rls->n_out; ++j) 00939 if (rls->add_constant) 00940 for (i=1; i<=rls->n_in-1; ++i) 00941 y[j] += rls->beta[i][j] * x[i]; 00942 else 00943 for (i=1; i<=rls->n_in; ++i) 00944 y[j] += rls->beta[i][j] * x[i]; 00945 00946 return TRUE; 00947 } 00948 00949 /*!***************************************************************************** 00950 ******************************************************************************* 00951 \note recursiveLeastSquares 00952 \date September 2006 00953 00954 \remarks 00955 00956 performs recursive least squares with forgetting factor and 00957 weight 00958 00959 ******************************************************************************* 00960 Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output 00961 00962 \param[in,out] rls : data structure of rls 00963 \param[in] x : input data vector (without constant) 00964 \param[in] y : output data vector 00965 \param[in] w : weight of this data point 00966 00967 ******************************************************************************/ 00968 void 00969 recursiveLeastSquares(RLSStatisticsPtr rls, double *x, double *y, double w) 00970 { 00971 int i,j; 00972 double xPx; 00973 double denom; 00974 00975 // assign inputs and outputs to local data structures 00976 if (rls->add_constant) { 00977 for (i=1; i<=rls->n_in-1; ++i) 00978 rls->x[i] = x[i]; 00979 rls->x[rls->n_in] = 1; 00980 } else { 00981 for (i=1; i<=rls->n_in; ++i) 00982 rls->x[i] = x[i]; 00983 } 00984 00985 for (i=1; i<=rls->n_out; ++i) 00986 rls->y[i] = y[i]; 00987 00988 // compute Px term 00989 mat_vec_mult(rls->P,rls->x,rls->Px); 00990 00991 // compute xPx term 00992 xPx = vec_mult_inner(rls->x,rls->Px); 00993 denom = rls->lambda/w + xPx; 00994 00995 // compute the entire P update 00996 for (i=1; i<=rls->n_in; ++i) { 00997 for (j=i; j<=rls->n_in; ++j) { 00998 rls->P[i][j] = (rls->P[i][j] - rls->Px[i]*rls->Px[j]/denom)/rls->lambda; 00999 } 01000 } 01001 01002 // compute regression update 01003 mat_vec_mult(rls->P,rls->x,rls->Px); 01004 vec_mat_mult(rls->x,rls->beta,rls->pred); 01005 vec_sub(rls->y,rls->pred,rls->error); 01006 01007 for (i=1; i<=rls->n_in; ++i) { 01008 for (j=1; j<=rls->n_out; ++j) { 01009 rls->beta[i][j] = rls->beta[i][j] + w*rls->Px[i]*rls->error[j]; 01010 } 01011 } 01012 01013 // update some statistics 01014 vec_mat_mult(rls->x,rls->beta,rls->pred); 01015 vec_sub(rls->y,rls->pred,rls->error); 01016 01017 rls->n_data = rls->lambda*rls->n_data + 1; 01018 rls->nMSE = 0; 01019 for (i=1; i<=rls->n_out; ++i) { 01020 rls->sum_error2[i] = rls->sum_error2[i]*rls->lambda + sqr(rls->error[i]); 01021 rls->sum_y[i] = rls->sum_y[i]*rls->lambda + y[i]; 01022 rls->sum_y2[i] = rls->sum_y2[i]*rls->lambda + sqr(y[i]); 01023 rls->nMSE += rls->sum_error2[i]/ 01024 (rls->sum_y2[i] - sqr(rls->sum_y[i])/rls->n_data + 1.e-10); 01025 } 01026 rls->nMSE /= (double)rls->n_out; 01027 01028 } 01029 01030 /*!***************************************************************************** 01031 ******************************************************************************* 01032 \note initRecursiveLeastSquares 01033 \date September 2006 01034 01035 \remarks 01036 01037 initializes a rls data structure and allocates all memory 01038 01039 ******************************************************************************* 01040 Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output 01041 01042 \param[in] n_in : number of inputs (without constant) 01043 \param[in] n_out : number of outputs 01044 \param[in] add_constant : TRUE/FALSE to add constant to inputs 01045 \param[in] ridge : ridge factor 01046 \param[in] lambda : forgetting factor 01047 \param[in] name : name of rls model 01048 01049 ******************************************************************************/ 01050 RLSStatisticsPtr 01051 initRecursiveLeastSquares(int n_in, int n_out, int add_constant, 01052 double ridge, double lambda, char *name) 01053 { 01054 int i; 01055 RLSStatisticsPtr rls; 01056 01057 if (add_constant) 01058 ++n_in; 01059 01060 // get data structure and memory 01061 rls = (RLSStatisticsPtr) my_calloc(1,sizeof(RLSStatistics),MY_STOP); 01062 rls->P = my_matrix_symm(1,n_in,1,n_in); 01063 rls->beta = my_matrix(1,n_in,1,n_out); 01064 rls->Px = my_vector(1,n_in); 01065 rls->x = my_vector(1,n_in); 01066 rls->y = my_vector(1,n_out); 01067 rls->pred = my_vector(1,n_out); 01068 rls->error= my_vector(1,n_out); 01069 01070 rls->sum_error2= my_vector(1,n_out); 01071 rls->sum_y2 = my_vector(1,n_out); 01072 rls->sum_y = my_vector(1,n_out); 01073 01074 // assign variables 01075 rls->n_in = n_in; 01076 rls->n_out = n_out; 01077 rls->ridge = ridge; 01078 rls->add_constant = add_constant; 01079 rls->lambda = lambda; 01080 rls->n_data = 0; 01081 strcpy(rls->name,name); 01082 01083 for (i=1; i<=n_in; ++i) 01084 rls->P[i][i] = 1./(ridge+1.e-10); 01085 01086 return rls; 01087 } 01088 01089 /*!***************************************************************************** 01090 ******************************************************************************* 01091 \note writeRLS 01092 \date September 2006 01093 01094 \remarks 01095 01096 write the given RLS to file 01097 01098 ******************************************************************************* 01099 Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output 01100 01101 \param[in] rls : data structure of rls 01102 01103 ******************************************************************************/ 01104 int 01105 writeRLS(RLSStatisticsPtr rls) 01106 { 01107 FILE *out; 01118 01119 // the defining main structure 01120 if (fwrite(rls,sizeof(RLSStatistics),1,out)!= 1) { 01121 printf( "cannot fwrite file.\n" ); 01122 return FALSE; 01123 } 01124 01125 // now all the matrices and vectors 01126 fwrite_mat(out,rls->P); 01127 fwrite_mat(out,rls->beta); 01128 fwrite_vec(out,rls->sum_error2); 01129 fwrite_vec(out,rls->sum_y2); 01130 fwrite_vec(out,rls->sum_y); 01131 01132 fclose(out); 01133 01134 printf("done\n"); 01135 01136 return TRUE; 01137 01138 } 01139 01140 /*!***************************************************************************** 01141 ******************************************************************************* 01142 \note readRLS 01143 \date September 2006 01144 01145 \remarks 01146 01147 read the given RLS from file 01148 01149 ******************************************************************************* 01150 Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output 01151 01152 \param[in] rls : data structure of rls 01153 01154 ******************************************************************************/ 01155 RLSStatisticsPtr 01156 readRLS(char *name) 01157 { 01158 FILE *in; 01175 return NULL; 01176 } 01177 01178 if (rls.add_constant == 1) 01179 --rls.n_in; 01180 01181 rls_ptr = initRecursiveLeastSquares(rls.n_in, rls.n_out, rls.add_constant, 01182 rls.ridge, rls.lambda, rls.name); 01331 return NULL; 01332 } 01333 01334 hist_ptr = initHistogram(hist.min, hist.max, hist.n_bins, 01335 hist.lambda, hist.name); 01336 01337 // now all the matrices and vectors 01338 fread_vec(in,hist_ptr->n_data_bin); 01348 01349 return hist_ptr; 01350 01351 } 01352 01353 /*!***************************************************************************** 01354 ******************************************************************************* 01355 \note histogramClassifier 01356 \date September 2006 01357 01358 \remarks 01359 01360 a 1D histogram classifier 01361 01362 ******************************************************************************* 01363 Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output 01364 01365 \param[in,out] hist : data structure of histogram 01366 \param[in] x : input data 01367 \param[in] s : s >= 0.5 success, s < 0.5 failure 01368 \param[in] w : weight of this data point 01369 01370 ******************************************************************************/ 01371 void 01372 histogramClassifier(HistogramStatisticsPtr hist, double x, double s, double w) 01373 { 01374 int i,j; 01375 double delta; 01376 int n; 01377 01378 // determine into which bin x falls 01379 delta = (hist->max - hist->min)/(double)hist->n_bins; 01380 n = (int) rint((x - hist->min)/delta); 01381 if (n < 1) 01382 n = 1; 01383 if (n > hist->n_bins) 01384 n = hist->n_bins; 01385 01386 // update the statistics of this bin 01387 if ( s > 0.5) 01388 s = 1.0; 01389 else 01390 s = 0.0; 01391 01392 hist->n_data_bin[n]= hist->n_data_bin[n] * hist->lambda + w; 01393 hist->n_success[n] = hist->n_success[n] * hist->lambda + s*w; 01394 hist->p[n] = hist->n_success[n]/hist->n_data_bin[n]; 01395 01396 ++hist->n_data; 01397 01398 } 01399 01400 /*!***************************************************************************** 01401 ******************************************************************************* 01402 \note predictHistogram 01403 \date September 2006 01404 01405 \remarks 01406 01407 performs a prediction with the Histogram structure and neighborhood 01408 smoothing 01409 01410 ******************************************************************************* 01411 Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output 01412 01413 \param[in] hist : data structure of histogram 01414 \param[in] n_data_min : minumum data in bin to perform prediction 01415 \param[in] n_neigbors : average over how many neighbor bins? 01416 \param[in] x : input data point 01417 \param[out] y : output (probability of success) 01418 01419 ******************************************************************************/ 01420 int 01421 predictHistogram(HistogramStatisticsPtr hist, int n_data_min, 01422 int n_neighbors, double x, double *y) 01423 { 01424 int i,j; 01425 double delta; 01426 int n; 01427 double sum_w; 01428 double sum_data; 01429 double sum_data_bin; 01430 int sn,en; 01431 double w; 01432 01433 // check for sufficient data 01434 if (hist->n_data < n_data_min) { 01435 *y = 0.5; 01436 return FALSE; 01437 } 01438 01439 // determine into which bin x falls 01440 delta = (hist->max - hist->min)/(double)hist->n_bins; 01441 n = (int) rint((x - hist->min)/delta); 01442 if (n < 1) 01443 n = 1; 01444 if (n > hist->n_bins) 01445 n = hist->n_bins; 01446 01447 sn = n - n_neighbors; 01448 if (sn < 1) 01449 sn = 1; 01450 en = n + n_neighbors; 01451 if (en > hist->n_bins) 01452 en = hist->n_bins; 01453 01454 sum_w = 1.e-10; 01455 sum_data = 0.0; 01456 sum_data_bin = 0.0; 01457 for (i=sn; i<=en; ++i) { 01458 w = ((n_neighbors - abs(n-i)) * 2.0 + 1)*hist->n_data_bin[i]; 01459 sum_w += w; 01460 sum_data += hist->p[i] * w; 01461 sum_data_bin += hist->n_data_bin[i] * w; 01462 } 01463 01464 // check for sufficient data in bin 01465 if (sum_data_bin/sum_w < n_data_min || sum_w == 0.0) { 01466 *y = 0.5; 01467 return FALSE; 01468 } 01469 01470 *y = sum_data/sum_w; 01471 return TRUE; 01472 01473 } 01474
